alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Crawford; Houston; Peach; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 9:06PM EDT until June 25 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Bibb County in central Georgia... Southeastern Crawford County in central Georgia... North Central Houston County in central Georgia... Northeastern Peach County in central Georgia... West Central Twiggs County in central Georgia... * Until 300 AM EDT. * At 906 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Macon, Fort Valley, Warner Robins, Centerville, Byron, Jack Brown Estates, Powerville, Lakewood, Skipperton, Middle Georgia Regional Airport, Rutland, Elberta and Miami Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
